metadata.title: CVE-2022-27457 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
MariaDB Server v10.6.3 and below was discovered to contain anuse-after-free in the component my_mb_wc_latin1 at /strings/ctype-latin1.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-27457` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadb3 - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libmariadbd19 - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-backup - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-client - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-client-10.3 - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-client-core-10.3 - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-common - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-plugin-rocksdb - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-plugin-tokudb - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-server - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-server-10.3 - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-server-core-10.3 - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-test - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mariadb-test-data - 1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.3 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:10.3.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
